bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 94 (Friday, June 12, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BOUSTANY:H.R. 2758.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clauses 4 and 18[Page H4344]

item.name: Immigration Integrity, Security, and Enforcement Subcommittee

item.title: Strengthen Employment And Seasonal Opportunities Now (SEASON) Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security.

item.name: Immigration Integrity, Security, and Enforcement Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide that a returning H-2B alien (temporary nonagricultural worker) who has already been counted toward the applicable numerical limitation during one of the three preceding fiscal years: (1) shall not again be counted toward such limitation during a fiscal year, but (2) shall be considered a returning worker.

bill.title: To make permanent the returning worker exception to the annual numerical limitation on nonimmigrant visas issued under section 101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(b) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, and for other purposes.

item.title: To make permanent the returning worker exception to the annual numerical limitation on nonimmigrant visas issued under section 101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(b) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, and for other purposes.

To make permanent the returning worker exception to the annual numerical limitation on nonimmigrant visas issued under section 101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(b) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
